definitions.definition: to puzzle , perplex , baffle , bewilder ( somebody ) ; to afflict by being complicated, contradictory, or otherwise difficult to understand
examples: It confused me when I went to the office and nobody was there, but then I realised it was Sunday.

definitions.definition: To mix up , muddle up ( one thing with another ) ; to mistake ( one thing for another ) .
examples: People who say " hola " to Italians are confusing Italian with Spanish.

definitions.definition: To mix thoroughly; to confound ; to disorder .
To make uneasy and ashamed ; to embarrass .

main_definition: ( transitive ) to puzzle , perplex , baffle , bewilder ( somebody ) ; to afflict by being complicated, contradictory, or otherwise difficult to understand
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To mix up , muddle up ( one thing with another ) ; to mistake ( one thing for another ) .
( transitive ) To mix thoroughly; to confound ; to disorder .
( transitive , dated ) To make uneasy and ashamed ; to embarrass .
